task.title: Task: Break-even coffee stand
task.shortdesc: A simple exercise for the use of the method Goal Seek.

context.p: Suppose you want to run a coffee stand in a soccer stadium. The monthly costs for rent, staff and miscellaneous are known. You also know the costs and sales price for a cup of coffee. In the next figure, you see a model for calculating the monthly results, depending on the number of cups of coffee sold.

fig.title: Calculation model for coffee stand Stadium

image.alt: Calculation model for coffee stand stadium

context.p: What you would like to know now is how many cups of coffee you have to be sell per month to be break-even. In this simple example, you can easily calculate the answer by hand. However, the method Goal Seek as well.

step.cmd: Choose tab Data What-If Analysis (group Forecast) Goal Seek .
step.stepresult: The dialog box Goal Seek appears

step.cmd: Specify the values for Goal Seek.

dlentry.dd: The address of the cell that contains the formula for which you want a specific result. In this example, it is the cell with the monthly result.
This is the desired result for the formula, hence the target. For break-even, the value is 0.
The address of the changing cell to achieve the target. This is the number of cups of coffee to sell.

fig.title: Dialog box Goal Seek for the coffee stand

image.alt: Dialog box goal seek for the coffee stand

stepresult.p: Excel starts calculating and finds the value 562.5. Because you don't sell half cups of coffee you will need to round the answer to 563.
